qas.question: Why did Greg Dyke of London Weekend Television meet with representatives of the biggest five English football clubs in 1990?

answers.text: The meeting was to pave the way for a break away from The Football League.

qas.question: Why did Dyke only want the larger clubs featured on national television?

answers.text: Dyke believed that it would be more lucrative for LWT if only the larger clubs in the country were featured on national television

qas.question: Did the five clubs think this was a good idea?

answers.text: The five clubs decided it was a good idea and decided to press ahead with it

qas.question: Were talks held with the Football Association to see if they were okay with this plan?

answers.text: David Dein of Arsenal held talks to see whether the FA were receptive to the idea

plausible_answers.text: it would be more lucrative for LWT if only the larger clubs in the country were featured on national television

qas.question: What did Dyke believe about the smaller clubs?
Which clubs decided it wasn't a good idea?

context: The managing director of London Weekend Television (LWT), <a4_0><b9_0><b11_0>Greg Dyke<b11_0/><b9_0/><a4_0/>, met with the representatives of the "big five" football clubs in <a6_0>England<a6_0/> in <a5_0><b10_0>1990<b10_0/><a5_0/>. <a0_0>The meeting was to pave the way for a break away from The Football League.<a0_0/> <a1_0>Dyke believed that <b12_0>it would be more lucrative for LWT if only the larger clubs in the country were featured on national television<b12_0/><a1_0/> and wanted to establish whether the clubs would be interested in a larger share of television rights money. <a2_0><b13_0>The five clubs<b13_0/> decided it was a good idea and decided to press ahead with it<a2_0/>; however, the league would have no credibility without the backing of The Football Association and so <a3_0><a7_0>David Dein<a7_0/> of Arsenal held talks to see whether the FA were receptive to the idea<a3_0/>. The FA did not enjoy an amicable relationship with the Football League at the time and considered it as a way to <a8_0>weaken the Football League's position<a8_0/>.
